title: You Feel Compared to Another Doctor
summary: A patient says they prefer another doctor in your office. Focus on growth over comparison: respect their preference, support the handoff, and grow without competing internally.

scene.setting: A patient says they prefer another doctor in your office. You may feel insecure or resentful; the hidden risk is comparison driving you and confidence suffering. The decision point is compete internally vs focus on your own growth.

beats.narration: They've stated their preference. The decision point is criticize or withdraw vs respect and support handoff.

dialogue.speaker: doc
dialogue.line: I respect that. I'll make sure your care is coordinated with them. If you ever want to see me again, I'm here.

choices.label: Criticize the other doctor subtly or imply limitations.

steps.step: Repair: respect their choice fully; offer to be available if needed; no defensiveness.

leader_lines: I want to respect your choice fully. How do we respond when they prefer someone else?
questions: What would make the handoff smooth?
How do I support you and them?
scripts.closing_line: Respect choice; offer availability; no defensiveness.

choices.label: Respect the patient's preference professionally and support the handoff.

steps.step: Respect preference; support handoff; no defensiveness.
One growth move: ask for feedback when appropriate, focus on own strengths, or learn from colleagues without competing.

leader_lines: I respect your choice. I'll make sure everything is coordinated.
questions: How do you grow without comparing?
scripts.closing_line: Ask for feedback when appropriate; focus on strengths; learn from colleagues.

choices.label: Withdraw emotionally and become distant with the patient.

steps.step: Acknowledge feeling then choose response; keep same quality of care; no cold shoulder.

leader_lines: Withdrawing doesn't protect confidence. I'll keep the same quality of care and support the handoff.
How do you stay professional when it stings?
questions: What would help you stay present?
scripts.closing_line: Acknowledge feeling; choose response; same quality of care.

choices.label: Thank them for being direct and offer to coordinate with the other doctor.

steps.step: Thank for being direct; offer to coordinate with the other doctor.
Track your own progress; get feedback from those you serve; celebrate others' wins.

leader_lines: Thanks for being direct. I'll coordinate with them so your care is seamless.
questions: How do you build confidence without comparison?
What do you track for yourself?
scripts.closing_line: Track own progress; get feedback; celebrate others' wins.

system_prompts.mirror_call: Did you compete internally or focus on growth?

outcomes.message: Patient may have felt uncomfortable. You chose competition over professionalism.
reflection_questions: What would have changed with respect-preference?
How do you respond when they prefer someone else?

outcomes.message: Patient felt respected. You showed maturity and team orientation; confidence isn't tied to their choice.
reflection_questions: How do you grow without comparing?
What did you learn from this?

tsp.weekly_pulse_prompt: This week I chose growth over comparison. (1-5)
